Summary Heading: Nice hotel, Nice rooms, front door needs a code to get in
Summary: I got really good service from a front desk Hal, Andrea Sam.   I had let my credit card overnight on the adjacent restaurant, and Andrea jumped through hoops to find it for me fast ! And helped me out with other things as well  Cudos Andrea !!!

Agree with many reviews on here. Extremely overpriced for a very tired hotel. No instructions given for how to get in so i wondered around for 10 minutes trying to get in.  Had room with the shared terrace which is quite nice but we were not aware it became the breakfast area each morning so woken early by noise. The breakfast was poor, very little choice, i could buy all this from the local shop.  Fabulous sunset from rooftop. Could not believe how busy the road outside was. Permanently jammed with hooting and shouting til very late.  Nicer looking hotels in other areas. We were happy to leave.

Summary Heading: Could be amazing but lacking in building maintainance and service offer, and not good value for money
Summary: The Dorymans's has a lot to offer but is missing in some key areas.  On the positive side, the location is excellent, the building is charming (old, with lots of old features such as the fireplace in our room 2 were lovely), and the staff were super friendly. Additionally, being connected to 21 Oceanfront restaurant and being able to order food from there for room service was an added bonus. On the negative side, the building needs maintainance and the service needs work. Rooms whilst tidy need maintainance. Bathrooms need regrouting and a deep clean, in the rooms some power sockets were broken, and lamps weren't working. Also no breakfast to speak of - a few boxes of tired looking cereal and some plastic wrapped bagels with packets of cream cheese were not inspiring at all
Room tip: Rooms are all on one floor numbered from left to right (facing the sea). Early numbered rooms...

Summary: This is a jewel across the beach. The staff Zoe and Elisa were both extremely customer focused. We stayed in room no 6 which was not sea facing but was very artistically furnished in old English style. The end was extremely comfortable and all amenities worked well. The bathroom was very well lit and very clean.  Two other great factors: free parking across the street and free continental breakfast with bagel and cream cheese

We enjoyed the location to all the great restaurants in the area. Our room was #6 very nice and clean with a king size bed, we wish you could lower ac down at night it got stuffy in room, I requested a fan and that helped somewhat! There was only one trashcan in room which was strange for the size room! The outdoor patio and rooftop patio were awesome. We had dinner brought to use from 21 Oceanfront and ate on the rooftop.... excellent meal! The front desk staff were really nice. It was sad seeing the homeless outside the front door in the early morning when we’d go to the donut shop.  The B & B did have a nice continental breakfast too. I would stay here again!

this is an "old elegance" hotel, and the service is perfect, very nice staff willing to help with reservations and any needs.  the breakfast is modest and nice, inc. muffins, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, good coffee, milk with cereal.  the deck is a great place to watch the sunset or enjoy coffee and watch the surfers.  the rooms are a bit tired but darling and the bed is comfy and pillows are ok. the location is in the middle of all the Newport action with 30 plus restaurants and bars within 1/4 mile.  the beach is a few steps away.  it is kinda noisy at night so wear earplugs or close the windows and turn on the a/c, we slep perfect.

Not impressed at all.  Stayed here a couple years back and not sure if they've gone downhill or if my taste in accommodations has refined, but this place was a total dump on my recent stay.  The location is great, the restaurant is delicious, but the price of the rooms is excessive for the substandard condition they are in.  I get the Victorian/antique vibe, and it's cute, but the rooms appear filthy, the beds have got to be the original ones since the place opened and the faucets in the bathroom are all rusted and gross. The carpeting also must be original and I wouldn't walk barefoot on it if you paid me to! Also, when paying almost $400 a night, I wouldn't think it too much to get a couple bottles of water in the room but apparently this isn't in their budget. I went to the

Summary Heading: Couples’ Getaway right on Newport Beach
Summary: My husband and I stayed at this unique hotel, right off the beach! The old-world charm was wonderful! We loved the antique furniture and the personal attention. It was so close to everything we wanted to do and literally right next door to Rockin’ Baja Lobster, which is always great! One very unique thing about this hotel is that it has a couple of secret passageways within the hotel! My husband loved that! This place is a gem, and we will always remember our stay there!❤️

The Doryman’s is more of a B&B and the location looks to be incredible as it is right on the beach.  The rooms are comfortable and we slept very well until 2am.  Unbeknownst to us the nearby bar scene spills into the parking lot behind the hotel and becomes very loud until about 4am.  We will skip this place on our next visit to Newport.

Lovely spot for a lovely hotel. Front desk staff was very nice. We were in room 6 which was wonderful and very well appointed. Plenty of tables to make the stay very comfortable. Breakfast was thoughtfully prepared. Special parking lot for overnight guests.

Summary Heading: a quaint old school bed and breakfast that is not for people that like to sleep!!!!
Summary: a very nice old time feel bed and breakfast, the staff is nice, the rooms are nice, clean, but very outdated. the carpet throughout the B&B needs to be replaced. the noise level at Baja sharkeez is exactly what all the reviews say it is, very loud, i knew that going in, I dont worry about sleep ,when I'm on vacation, you wont get any sleep. I didnt read in the reviews about the city street crews, that show up at 6 AM to vacuum and power wash right outside the B&B, that makes for absolutely no sleep.A good note for Baja Sharkeez, it's fun and the food is good. the Restaurant 21 Oceanfront is right down stairs and it is awesome, we ate their 2 times. I also didnt read on the reviews that the staff will let you park in your designated parking space before check in time, which will

Summary Heading: An Adventure and a Great Time!
Summary: We knew going in that the bar noise across the street would mean earplugs for a good nights sleep. But the charm of the old small hotel, the pier and ocean across the street, and shops and restaurants in walking distance made this an adventure worth taking! We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Doryman's Inn! If I had expected a quiet location after reading the reviews, I would have been setting myself up for disappointment. The staff members were all professional, kind and courteous. The breakfast gave us enough options that no one went hungry. The outside deck was delightful... who doesn't love a 360-degree view of the ocean and city? Apparently, several businesses nearby were brothels back in the day, and the hotel certainly gives off that same vibe. The furnishings are Victorian

Summary Heading: Lovely old hotel, great beach, noisey bars across the street.
Summary: This hotel is very charming, great views of the beach, clean and comfy.  The drawback is that it is located amidst some noisey bars and when they close at 2:00 am, it can wake you from a sound sleep and keep you awake as the revelers linger.  There is a wonderful farmer's market on Saturday mornings, right across the street.  Breakfast is good, coffee is terrible however, but a great coffeeshop is just across the street as well.

Summary Heading: Baja sharkeez( I think that’s the name) across the street is a deal killer
Summary: Overwhelmed by bar/crowd noise after being told I was in a quiet room......pure nonsense. Andrea at front desk very professional and kind but the neighborhood is a deal killer as the noise is completely incompatible with a “ bed and breakfast”

Summary Heading: Charming small hotel with a character!
Summary: Very charming and quaint hotel. The service is excellent and the details and decor are beautiful! Continental breakfast is modest, I'd love if they would add some fresh veggies to their fresh fruit option, and also some plain yogurt in addition to flavored ones. The only drawback in our particular room (#10) was that it was facing the bar across the street, so, no sleep until 2:30 am on Friday/Sat night d/t noise. Management needs to do something about sound-proofing that particular room. All the other rooms face the beach or the patio, so they don't have the same problem.

Second time we stayed at this hotel, purely by accident. The first time there was so much street noise and drunks wandering around you couldn't open the windows. This time we asked for a room not on the street and we had a bar right next to us. A bar that has a band every night until 1am, then the drunks came out to yell and scream.  When you arrive you have to call the reception desk because the door is locked to keep the vagrants out. Then you'll need to hump your luggage up 4 flights of stairs because the elevator is in perpetual state of repair and out-of-order.  There are no "quiet" rooms so bring earplugs and keep the windows closed. Pass on breakfast. Frozen vegan quiche, some fruit, cereal, yogurt and breads. When we were there, the milk had expired 2-days before we

We stayed here for 2 nights for the first time.  For the price of $300 a night, we expected a lot more.  TV difficult to operate.  Shower water low pressure & sounds like a jet engine.  Sink drains slowly.  No robes, no hair dryer.  Requested extra blanket - they do not have any.

I want to preface this review by mentioning that I stayed at Doryman's Inn 2 or 3 years ago and had a wonderful experience.  I was excited to return and was very much looking forward to my stay.  Unfortunately, this stay has not lived up to the experience I had previously.  The Inn itself is lovely and in a fabulous location.  Each room is unique with some rooms being larger than others.  When you make your reservation you select the specific room.  I reserved Bellagio because it is the largest of the rooms offered.  The space allows me to work out in the room which is important to me because there are no fitness centers on the peninsula.  I was given my room key when I checked in.  Since I have familiarity with the property, I didn't even look at my key before proceeding to the

We spent one night at Doryman's and had a great time. This makes for a great local stay-cation spot for a night or two or a nice place to stay if visiting the area. The rooms are all different and very nicely appointed. The location is right at the base of the pier and within walking distance to lots of restaurants and bars as well as shops around the beach area.  We had a package deal that included parking (can be a challenge if doing it on your own) and $$ towards dinner downstairs at 21 Ocean. The restaurant is excellent! I spent lots of time in Newport as a kid and it was fun to hang out and walk the area again. We will definately stay here again.

This place was amazing!!!  I stayed for 2 nights on vacation and can honestly say I would have loved to stay longer.  I stayed in room 3 and it is beautiful.  The decor and furnishing brings you back to the old days when craftsman took pride in their work.  The bed so VERY comfortable and the ocean view is breathtaking.  I had 2 windows that fully opened to let the ocean breeze in and the crashing waves made me completely relaxed.  It does get a bit noisy at night due to the bars next door but with the windows closed at night it is not bad at all.  The staff really goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome.  The lady that works during the day really was wonderful to talk to and really made my day. (I completely forgot her name though).  The other employee was Alyssa

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel in  the center of everything
Summary: The rooms are great and very homey. Every one of them has a view and listening to the ocean every night is the main reason I stay here. The sunken marble tub was wonderful and the free breakfast always starts the day off right. When you live in the desert this is where you want to stay.  I am going again this year.

Awesome 11 room Bed & Breakfast, with an awesome Steak & Seafood restaurant. Everything is yummy! At least 9 of the 11 rooms looks out to the Pacific Ocean and Newport Pier. Overlooks one of the nicest beaches anywhere. Great vantage points from inside the elegant lounge and on the roof. Great service.

Summary Heading: Very Affordable Little Gem just Steps from the Beach and Jetty
Summary: At first I was skeptical when booking this hotel, but when I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised at what it had to offer.  My friend who dropped me off thought I had found a really great place to stay and at a fantastic price.  Park at the drop off / loading and unloading public car park lots right in front of the hotel.  That would be the parking lots directly facing the bar on the ground floor of the hotel.  The entrance to the hotel is not via the bar but through a small door on the other side of the building.  There will be a keypad that unlocks the door, call ahead to get the pin number.  I had to walk up two flights of stairs to get to the front desk as the elevator was not working the entire time I was there.  So yes, I had to lug my 25kg luggage up when checking in and

What a lovely Inn!  Could close my eyes and go back in time.  When we checked in the gal at the desk was very kind and informative.  Stayed in room #5, queen bed with fireplace, ocean view and marble shower.  Bed was comfy, room was quaint, not very big but very nice.  We did open the windows when we went to bed and unfortunately the noise of the passerby's was quit loud.  In the morning we realized had we kept the window closed it would not have been so loud.  .  I loved how they kept all the doors opened at check in so you could see the rooms.   There are only 11 I believe.  We had the breakfast and I loved the mushroom quiche/tart!!!!!  Coffee, fruit, yogurt, tart and bagels.  Not a large selection but good.   We sat up on the roof top and watched the sun go down and enjoyed

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location.  More of a old distinguished hotel than a B&B
Summary: I would call this more of a distinguished hotel than a B&B.  Yes, the rooms are all different, cozy and decorated in an old style.  But it has the layout and breakfast that is more of a hotel.  We really enjoyed the stay.  Yes, there was some noise, but when we closed the windows, we could barely hear any outside noise.  Plus we were not there to get a lot of sleep.  Staff was friendly, but could have received more help in how to park for check in and how and when to check in. Parking is over behind Sharkee's.  We stayed in the Bellagio suite, which was a bigger room with a bigger bathroom on the North side of the building with a partial oceanview.  Rooms 1, 2, 3, 5, 7 & 8 are all on the westside with a full oceanview.  Location is great, right in the heart of Newport Beach.

Bad breakfast offerings. No cream or milk,no staff visible for help,tired frozen bagels.Room 6 smelled like sewer gas.This B&B/hotel prides themselves on their great breakfast pastries, none present. Parking is 3 blocks away and problematic.

Summary Heading: Small Staff took great care of us
Summary: After a debacle at Balboa Inn, I was lucky to have the reservation transferred to this location.  The front desk person was very helpful, she made sure I understood the parking situation and showed me around.    We had the room right next to the small breakfast area.  What it lacked in privacy it made up for in space and comfort.  The breakfast was tasty, the roof top deck was a nice touch, and the location can't be beat.    If you have the opportunity, I would highly recommend staying here.

Beautiful old world hotel. Room #6 was spacious, private and quiet. Excellent location for a cozy day at the beach and a crazy night on the town! It says Bed & Breakfast. But the "breakfast" was not impressive even on the "continental" scale. But we will definitely come again. It's worth the price. Great time ❤️

Summary Heading: Super nice, historic inn on the beach and close to restaurants
Summary: I booked this hotel for friends of mine who were visiting.  Their room had an ocean view, with a fireplace, super comfy bed and beautiful marble bathtub.  It is only a few steps to the beach which is nice because parking near here is very hard.  This Inn does offer valet parking, and they have a breakfast buffet.  I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars just because the location is congested and can be loud at night.  At the same time if you want to hangout at fun bars and restaurants without driving it's the perfect spot.

Looking at the pictures of the rooms, they are exactly as they look.  This is a vey old property, but well kept.  The desk clerks were so nice and helpful, I can't say enough about them!  As we were bringing our luggage from the parking garage a worker, who was leaving for the day assisted us, which he didn't have to do.  The desk clark upgraded us the first night, since we didn't need two beds that night to an oceanfront room. The ocean breeze was wonderful  You can hear the people outside, but understandably with the window open and being right on the boardwalk.  The second night we were in the back and was offered a different room.  It was a Friday night and again we had the windows open to have a nice breeze, so we were subjected to the noise from the local bars on each

Very cool old world décor.  Check in was very nice and evening staff were extremely helpful.  Overall a great experience.   Loved being able to go to the restaurant downstairs without going outside in the cold.   Will definitely be back!

We were looking for a quaint hotel in Newport Beach area, and we got that....and so much more.  First the staff is great. From minute we got there till we waved goodbye they were helpful and wonderful.   We had the corner suite and it was great.  Fantastic view of the pier, beach and street below.  Yes noisy at night but not awful. The rooms are old but beautifully decorated.   Fireplace was great since it was in 50s at night.  The restaurant downstairs was awesome. Denise a great server.  When you stay at Doryman Inn you will have a wonderfully romantic adventure.   You only live once....experience life at places like Doryman Inn.

This B and B is charming and brilliantly situated. The staff are helpful and kind, and the room we were in was very comfortable. Breakfast is good- not exceptional for a B and B, but tasty and a good start to the day.  The biggest challenge with a few rooms is late night noise, particularly on weekends, as the neighboring restaurants are busy and loud. But the staff at the inn made sure we were prepared and offered all means of assistance if the noise bothered us, which it did not. Parking is great (which is a big benefit in this area) and it was absolutely wonderful to walk outside and be right at the beach. A great place to stay!!

Based on previous reviews, we decided to spend a night at this hotel. We spent the night in room 6 which is uniquely furnished. We felt like we were in a 1930's New Orleans hotel.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The gal at the front desk was not only friendly but extremely informative about places to see and dine near the hotel.  We are definitely heading back for a weekend in the near future

Summary Heading: Cute hotel, but VERY loud at night
Summary: The Doryman has a lot of potential – each room is unique, the service is friendly, and it’s in a perfect/central location.  However, it is unbelievably loud at night, even in the rooms that don’t face the boardwalk/beach.  One of the other reviewers noted that they should install soundproof windows and I couldn’t agree more.  Simply offering ear plugs is not a solution to this problem. The rooms themselves are all unique with old-fashioned décor – ours had a big canopy bed which was nice.  Breakfast was included in the rate, but was pretty underwhelming – I’d recommend skipping it and getting something to eat somewhere else.  They should also communicate the passcode for the door before check-in – it was a big pain to just get into the hotel while toting several suitcases.  At

I so enjoyed our stay at the Doryman!  The rooms are beautiful and the view is spectacular!   The staff were very  helpful and warm.  The breakfast was perfect as well.  We loved the little quiches.  You can sit outside or in your room.  It is very clean and well kept.  It is located right at the pier and in the middle of lots of bars and business so it can be noisy.  The desk gave us earplugs the second night and that solved the problem.  We slept till 9:30 which we never do.  The restaurant downstairs-21 Oceanfront is fantastic.  Do not miss it.  We loved it and went there 2 nights! We will go back. On suggestion-The pillows were not very good.

I would have loved to give this place a 5 star rating. The location, facility and staff certainly deserve that rating. The Inn is located as near the pier as possible and close to all sorts of great eating places and walking paths. The building is 150 years old and has been wonderfully decked out. Our room was huge, with a fireplace, the biggest jetted tub I've ever seen, comfortable bed--everything you imagine a great B&B to provide. BUT, the noise outside was awful. I'm a person who sleeps through nearly anything, but it sounded like the entire tourist crowd was camped out at the end of our bed. The yelling and laughing was constant until 2:00 a.m. They do provide ear plugs if you ask, but good luck sleeping with those things. I would love to return, but won't go back. The

Quaint old-world rooms. We had Room 1 which had fantastic views of the beaches, boardwalk and the pier.  Centre stage for everything.  Cafe's, Bars and restaurants, all within a short walking distance. Free parking was avaliable less than 50 meters away.

We loved the place, the view( fabulous), the location- close to everything!. But the noise outside our window on the street below prevented any sleep at night! What was to be a relaxing getaway instead left us exhausted! The gal at the front desk gave us earplugs when we checked in...hhmmm. better to install thicker windows and blackout drapes to help muffle the noise. Otherwise we thought it was a charming place. So if you are a late night partier, and don't need lots of sleep, you will love it!

We are back again for our yearly visit, even if we did stay here 3 months ago. This is a wonderful place. Beautiful rooms, terrific service and a parking place. What more could you ask for. This is our 4th year, I'm sure there will be a 5th. The only thing I can say is: when you stay here you don't want to miss the restaurant. 21 Ocean front is one of the best.

This Inn is described as an Inn or Bed & Breakfast .  It's really both, with the personal working the front desk and the breakfast servers and housekeepers being the best reasons to stay here, other than location.  Yes, it can be noisy with the crowds right below but that did not bother me at all.  It was fun to be a part of the boardwalk "scene". The sounds of the surf, proximity to the beach, and gorgeous sunsets made this an excellent choice for me!!!

Just one night but we will definitely return.  Quiet, ornate and a beautiful setting.  Everybody was so friendly. The morning gratis continental breakfast was a bonus. Dinner right downstairs through the private entrance adjacent to the hotel was also 5 star - GREAT PLACE and wonderful experience!!!!

Summary Heading: Not the same as it was on our honeymoon!
Summary: My husband and I went to the Doryman's Inn to celebrate our 27th wedding anniversary. It was nostalgic for us, because we spent our honeymoon there in 1989. At first it was a great reminder of what we had experienced then, but as our visit continued we became aware that the place and service was not what it was then!  We also came to the conclusion that the Inn had not kept up with the times or upgraded their facilities. Very disappointing!   The room was #7 with a nice view of Newport Beach. The windows were open and the ocean breeze coming in was wonderful.  The parking situation was ok. The parking was a block away and we had to bring in our own bags. When I asked if we could store our bags in the Inn while our room was prepared they paused and then said sure, they can be

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but walls are thin
Summary: The hotel is very unique and in a good location.  Unfortunately, they placed us in a room right next to where the employees are and they were talking all night and we could hear every word they were saying. This lasted to at least until  1 am. The breakfast was very disappointing.  They had only a few items--fruit,cereal,bread and mini quiches.  At 7 am we heard the microwave going to heat the food which also woke us up.  It would seem they could at least invest in a toaster oven and not microwave their breakfast food. There was no information about WiFi codes or things to do around the area.  Usually hotels have a welcome book.  We never saw anyone at the front desk throughout the whole trip.  They were always sitting in the back.

Glad we found this place.  It is a very neat older place and was very inviting.  The location is the best!!!!  It is right at the Newport pier.  It's like stepping back in time, but don't let that fool you it's very relaxing.

I have finally found an establishment worthy of this privilege and also deserving enough for 5 stars!  I've been blessed to be given the opportunity to stay a couple of nights at the Doryman's Inn (Bed & Breakfast) in Newport Beach, CA and it is this experience that I am dedicating my 100th Yelp review to.   The Doryman's Inn B&B is located right at the corner of a lovely sector in this beach community and is surrounded by a variety of dining establishments and various shops; not to mention the boardwalk, pier and sandy shoreline, all outside its doorstep.   I will first start with its convenience and safety/security features. This B&B is literally at the street-corner of a block that is across the street from the beach. This B&B is also located upstairs, on top of a gourmet

Can't say enough good things about this place. The room was beautiful, the staff was friendly and helpful, and you can't beat the location. We even walked out on the pier at night and saw a family of seals (or maybe sea lions) playing in the water!

Me and my husband were driving to San Diego and decided to sleep in Newport Beach. We drove by the beach and suddenly found this B and B that is really amazing. Very close to the pier, fantastic night life on the street and with a beautiful view from the beach. The rooms are decorated as Victorian style and it is really coZy. Breakfast is great and the receptionist both at night and during the day were great! Definitely would come again and spend few other days! Also, the beach is super clean, water is cold and it is a nice place to rest during the day.

Straight across from the Newport Pier, most people walk by and don't realize it's there. Up above the 21 Ocean Restaurant is the nicest little hotel with the nicest people in Newport. Every room is different, all having Victorian influence. We found it by reading a flier on the sidewalk that listed a special including a 1 night stay, a bottle of champagne and $120 towards dinner. We liked it so much, we have been back 3 years in a row. And we will be back next year. It just seems to be the perfect birthday gift.  I recommend a beach view room, and don't miss the dinner. The location can't be beat, specially if you like walks on the beach.

I've stayed here twice.  The ambiance is very old English.  Lots of floral wallpaper and antiques.  It's a different vibe for bustling Newport Beach but I liked it because it was different.  The location is amazing right next to the pier.  It can be a bit loud on weekends but that wouldn't stop me from returning.  Besides, Oceanfront 21 is right downstairs so a great meal awaits.   Doryman's gave us a discount for dinner which was great!

This oceanfront B and B is a wonderful place to stay.  Most of the rooms have wonderful ocean views.  The breakfast is yummy and the rooms are very nice.  We have stayed many times - starting on our honeymoon and just recently on our 18th anniversary,  If you are a light sleeper, know that noise can be a problem.  There are several bars nearby.  The hotel does have ear plugs if needed.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location but can definitely beat the rooms!
Summary: Being steps to the sand, you can't beat the location..... if you want to party that is. You're literally above the bars and nightlife of Newport Beach which worked out perfectly for us, but if you're looking for a quiet place to lay your head down at night, this is not it. While charming on the outside, the rooms are old. Very characteristically old. The carpets are dirty, halls are musky, and the entire place is in need of huge renovation and attention. At least their large price tag comes with breakfast items. As long as you're looking for location over comfort or luxury, this is your spot!    Just below the hotel is a GREAT bar with live music called the BLUE BEET. They had good real food (vs bar food) during the day and poured cocktails with a heavy hand at night. They have

I was in town for a friend's daughters wedding. I found Doryman's online and booked it.   From the moment I came into the lobby I was greeted with a smiling friendly young women. The room was clean, cozy, and so inviting. The views of the ocean from Room 1 are spectacular. It can be a bit noisy if you leave the windows open all night, but if you close the or only leave them open a few inches you'll be fine. The bed was so comfortable; not too hard and not to soft. The pillows were just right too.  They have a happy hour downstairs in the restaurant which gave you a nice selection  of drinks and food to choose from. They also have a wonderful Continental breakfast in the morning; fresh fruit, bagels, cereals, eggs, juices, and coffee.   All the staff were so nice and friendly

For my wife's birthday I took her to this once beautiful hotel. The carpet is frayed and dirty, the paint chipped, cables hanging down from the back of the TV which needs to be turned on manually. The beds are rock hard. And all this for $450 a night!

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel right on the beach
Summary: We stayed in this hotel to our way to San Diego, and this is one of the best inns we've stayed in. Nice service, best location, restaurants.. We loved it. Right out of the door there is a local fish-market, wharf, and nice beach

I had won a one stay at this B&B  through a work raffle. My wife once lived walking distance from this place so we  were glad to try the place out and we were not disappointed. The rooms were comfortable and we had a view of the beach even though it was through a thick screen. We had dinner at the restaurant below then spent the time walking around the area. If you stay you must stop by Mutt Linches (sp). I saw that some people complained about the noise but remember you are in Newport right next to the pier. I would love to stay another night !!!!!

The hotel is charming, and right across from the beach. It gets noisy due to the parking lot, but I didn't have a problem sleeping if the windows were closed.  There's a lovely breakfast, and Nam was very helpful when I needed and iron or cream for my coffee.

Summary Heading: Restoration at this Victorian Gem of a hotel
Summary: If you love antiques and Victorian furnishings, your own private fireplace, a canopy bed, ocean views out your windows, breakfast on a rooftop setting, then you will love the Doryman Inn.  This hotel is spotless.  It is friendly and it is safe.   I stayed here by myself and felt right at home and very safe.   My room was huge.   It had a couch, a table and chairs, paintings on the walls, a beautiful bathroom, mirrors everywhere, a TV, internet access and privacy.   I stayed here because of a family member who had surgery.   This was the perfect spot for peace and restoration while dealing with the stress of the surgery.   I would absolutely return here in a heartbeat.   I was steps from the Newport Pier and the beach.

Friends from Arizona were in town to visit family and, more importantly, celebrate a 60th birthday. At first the thought was to have dinner at 21 Oceanfront, the 4-star restaurant on the first floor of this building but when my wife saw an Overnight Getaway Package on Doryman's website, we decided to host our friends.   We arrived promptly at 3:00 pm in order to take advantage of this fun, historical hotel. Our friends from Arizona had never been and our last visit was perhaps 10 years ago. They were immediately taken with the architecture, the classic paintings and the antique adorned rooms. Because we were there early, despite the hotel being full that evening, we could take a tour of nearly all the rooms.   They were in room #8 which has a canopy bed, a small couch and

Summary Heading: My absolute most favorite spot in Southern California
Summary: If you're into a quaint spot with amazingly decorated rooms that make you wish you never had to leave Doryman's inn is your home away form home. Perfect location in the heart of the Newport life. Great views and right on the boardwalk. Fabulous restaurants and the most helpful kind staff ever.  Of all the places I've ever stayed this one just captivates me each time.

This is a great small hotel located right on the beach with a great restaurant. All located in an historical building that was remodeled to the highest standards. Each room has a gas burning fireplace and furnished in Victoria style antique furniture. I stayed in unit #5 overlooking the beach but next time will ask for unit #1 located on the corner of the building.

We stayed here on our wedding night and 15 yrs later for our anniversary! We loved the fireplace and view of the ocean. Instead of a sign offering ear plugs at the front desk, they should automatically be provided in the oceanfront rooms. The bed was super comfortable but I got NO sleep due to the constant noise on the boardwalk! The breakfast could also be nicer including actual coffee mugs instead of paper cups. Overall it was a nice staycation for our anniversary & we had a wonderful dinner at 21 Oceanfront!

This is a small and Friendly bed and breakfast/hotel and some of the rooms have oceanview. The beds are comfortable. The entire hotel is very clean and well maintained. The Continental breakfast is better than many other hotel in USA with not only sweet bread/muffins and marmelade but also fruitsalad, juice, yoghurt and this morning some delicius small warm qiuche. Free wi-fi that works fine. An excellent bar with live music on first floor and Also a restaurant with deliciuos food. The only thing we missed was a safe in the room.

We decided to stay a few nights just to get out of the house. We don't live far so we are familiar with the neighborhood and expectations. Yes, it is a busy town, but we kept to ourselves and enjoyed the room, view and breakfast provided. Downstairs is an AMAZING restaurant called 21 Oceanfront, that is difficult to get into but being guests we were accommodated. The restaurant and hotel have the only sunset view in Newport Beach. I love this place a million times over and would recommend to anyone.

We reserved a room for my nieces wedding night.  It just so happened they had the same room available that my brother and sister in law stayed in.  The kids only had one night before returning to work and they loved the room and hotel.  It gave them a great day at the beach, too.

This was the only disappointing place we stayed in during a five week tour of USA. The room we had was No 3 but I also looked at No 2 and that looked equally tiny. By the time we had our cases in the room you literally could not walk around the bed. There are no conveniences in the room it is just filled of useless antiques. Incredibly crammed but not even a bedside table on one side of the bed. The room is literally one step down from reception so you can hear every time the phone rings and every word taking place - clearly that does nothing for the privacy in the room.  Breakfast was very poor. Water for coffee was luke warm both days the toaster did not pop up and only way to get bagel out was turn off toaster and use metal tongs to remove it! Was very happy to get out of

We've stayed here several times over many years and reviewed it favorably in the past. We can forgive the weird bathrooms and lack of breakfast for the great location of and charm.... Not to mention proximity to the donut shop. But the noise and crowds are just too much. A sign in the room actually offers ear plugs at the front desk???  The noise is considerable until 2am, and you won't sleep well. Plus the pier, square and immediate beach have gone down hill. Panhandling is rampant.

We enjoyed the decor, the rooms are filled with antiques and the staff is friendly and helpful.  The location, which is by the Newport Pier, is great for walking the boardwalk, the pier and also the beach.  The only negative is the noise level at night, however the staff provides ear plugs which helps.

We had a very nice stay at this very well located hotel. You can't find a nicer on-the-beach hotel than this! We had an ocean view room that was comfortable and nicely appointed. The staff were helpful and friendly, as well as very accommodating. Parking was easy and free! My only caveat is that if you are a light sleeper or have issues with noise the ocean side rooms with windows open could be disruptive, especially on a weekend night. However, you do get to hear the sound of the surf that will lull you to sleep!

The website gives you all the info you need. It is a great B&B directly across from the beach. If your room has a beach view you will hear noise from the beach goers etc.. However, I haven't stayed at many hotels that sell noiseless rooms. If you want a great B&B by the beach you can't go wrong!

Summary Heading: The best place in Newport beach to stay
Summary: I really loved this Inn. Wonderful "atmosphere" of old days, fireplace, ocean view, beach location, convenient access to the most restaurants, beach, etc..  I would recommend it to stay anyone - you will simply fall in love with this Inn.

Summary Heading: Wonderful B&B on Newport Beach opposite the pier
Summary: We had Room #4 (? -- the one right next to the front desk) which offered a  King bed, sitting room, gas fireplace and it was sheer heaven. The front-desk staff were friendly and efficient, the room was sparkling clean and full of personality, and the breakfasts were excellent. The bed was very comfortable, the gas fireplace was cozy and the roof-top terrace just outside the bedroom door overlooked the beach. The hotel provides free parking in busy Newport Beach. We plan to always stay there when we visit SoCal in the future.

My wife was still teary eyed on the way home. I surprised her with this romantic get away and she was so happy! We arrived early and Andrea let peek at all the rest of the rooms for a future visit. Not a bad room in the this beautiful B&B. Our room was on the corner and our beach view was almost a 180. We where welcomed with rose petals in foyer of our room and beautiful roses on the table. Andrea and Marion made us feel as like family in this beautifully decorated home. The nightlife and local eateries where great. We parked the car and forgot about it  till we left. It is on the board walk and there was noise but just close the window and it was fine. An early morning walk on the beach was just what we needed and then a nice breakfast on the patio.We are coming back next year

I was looking for a last-minute fun place to stay and have been by this place a million times. The location is fantastic, right on the pier. It's beautiful. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The inn itself was quiet...but, the location can be very loud due to the restaurants and bars on the pier. There were still people having fun in the parking lot at 2 am. I was there on Halloween but I think it is like that frequently. The inn does offer earplugs though. The location was worth it though!

Room #5 was great, actually all the rooms are wonderful and most have awesom ocean views, laying on my bed gazing at the blue ocean, early afternoon sun twinkling on the horizon, sailboats cruzing, a PERFECT slight cool breeze hitting my face, ahhhhhhhhh, if not for a palm tree I woulda thought I was on a private yacht !   MaryAnn  was great, her European accent added to the Victorian ambiance.   ok now,  you have to understand this is a HISTORIC VICTORIAN HOTEL,   so some things are going to be old but this adds to the charm , the antique books smell old...hmm cause their old !  everything is very very clean which surprised me, bed was very comfy , small rooms but that's what they had back in the day, fireplace was romantic...  our first nite we actually went to sleep bout 930

We took advantage of the special room/dinner package for our anniversary.  We have previously dined at 21 Oceanfront and it is always great.  The hotel is on top of the restaurant.  It is very quaint and the rooms we viewed were very nice.  I recommend the rooms in the front (1-7?) with an ocean view - it is spectacular.  Front desk was very helpful and nice.  One issue this hotel has on occasion is noise from the street when the bars let out.  Our room was great except for the kids that parked under our window at 3 AM and hung out for an hour or two.  Closing the windows helped a lot but it was still annoying.  All in all it was a great romantic getaway.  Being right on the beach we could walk for miles in either direction.  I expect the Fall/Winter is the best time because

Perhaps my husband and I didn't understand the charm that others have found in this B&B.  The location was great, only steps to the beach, and there are many places to eat and drink close.  The front desk person was welcoming but the overall decor both in the public spaces and in the rooms are several decades past their prime.  The room rate did include free parking, wi-fi and breakfast which made the victorian explosion decor more acceptable.  We had drinks in the bar below the hotel and had a terrific time there...Katie the bartender was a local and provided much information about old Newport Beach and the Inn.  Apparently it is "always" full and people return year after year to stay here.  I will say it was a unique experience and we may bring other back just to share it.

We stayed here for three nights.  The purpose of our trip was relaxation.  The Inn has an old Otis elevator, which opens to a lovely reception area.  They had put us in a beach front room.  It was extremely charming with antique furniture, a very romantic comfortable canopy bed, and wonderful Italian marble shower.  Our three windows overlooked their 5 star restaurant, 21 Oceanfront, and the beach.  We loved the cool ocean breeze which blew into our windows every day.  I worked in the room a few hours every day and found it refreshing to have such a beautiful view to look at.  Despite all of the warnings of previous guests, we left the windows open the first night.  Between the traffic, loud bars, shouting bar patrons and horns honking...we got very little sleep.  The next two

My fiance and I stayed at the Doryman's this past Labor Day weekend (Aug 31- Sept 3) and from the moment we arrived until the very last second we were there - our experience was great!!   Maryann (hope I am spelling it correctly) greeted us at the front desk and was such a nice friendly lady.  I'm sorry i did not get the chance to say good bye to her (that's how sweet she was).  Our check-in was smooth and fast and in a few minutes we were downstairs having a few cold ones at Blackie's with some of my fiance's friends. We had Room #3 which was a great room and the view.....amazing to wake up to every morning!!!  I truly loved the service at the Doryman's because they accommodated on every aspect, especially upon our check out.  We had a 9pm flight that Tuesday, but as you know

We celebrated one of the decade anniversaries and the Doryman's Inn is a fabulous place with great appeal, ambiance, service and location in Newport Beach.  Great area for dining, wining, beaching, local shopping and snacking.  The Doryman's Inn is attached to the restaurant "21" that is superb with access to your room and a quaint patio for evening sipping and a quick breakfast (comp). We loved the experience and service.  We will be back.

My best friend Kim and I spent tuesday through friday here for our annual birthday trip. I don't know why some people are never satisfied from other reviews. We had room 5 and it has 2 windows overlooking the ocean and pier. The staff bent over backwards if we needed anything like ice. The bed was sooo comfy and sheets were soft as a baby's butt! Great people watching! We slept fine despite life going on outside. Close to everything. I will def be back. I live in yorba linda ca but its nice to spend time at the beach. With houses on oceanfront charging 5 grand a week why not just stay here?

I found there very nice and helpful people who helped us accommodate easy. Everything was clean and comfortable. Hotel closed to the beach and food excellent. Room had a very nice view and the furniture very interesting (antique) :)

We booked at the Doryman hotel for three nights so we could be in Newport Beach to attend a wedding of a friend and my wife was having the clothes she purchased from Nordstroms to ware to the wedding delivered to the hotel. When the package arrived the front desk clerk refused to accept it even though she knew we were staying at the hotel. So I called the front desk to speak to the manager and the same clerk said i could not do that until Monday. The clerk constantly talked over the top of me while trying to explain the dilema as my wife had nothing to wear to the wedding because of her mistake. This got me no where and after a slight argument she said she didnt care about my problem and was calling the police to remove us from the hotel. That never happened. Obviously we will

Summary Heading: Surprised me in a good way!
Summary: I stayed here 3 nights mid May so it was just before school let out and was not too busy. That being said it was not loud outside like some reviews have said. I viewed the pictures on the website and could not really tell if this place was nice with old world charm or just looked dated. I was in awe of how beautiful my room was. The Bellagio room is huge and the bathroom is covered in marble. It is almost as big as the Jr suite we had in Vegas a few nights before. It does not feel like a B&B. It feels like a nice hotel. The only thing that makes it feel like a B&B is the size. With only 11 rooms its like you are the only guest some times. The front desk occasionally does not have anyone at it but a call to the displayed number always got us in touch when needed. The location is

My wife and I went here to celebrate our anniversary . The place seemed nice but there are bars that surround the place . We got absolutely no sleep , the noise went on until 3am two nights in a row .  If you are going to eat at the restaurant go with the steak , the lobster was horrible and very costly . People not very friendly .  Very cheap owner, they do not serve any happy hour ( wine cheese or crackers ) Nothing !    If you are 21 have money and like to party , this maybe a spot for you .

My husband and I spent a few nights at the beach on the way to another destination.  i was definitely in awe.  This is a beautiful Inn a stone's throw from the beach. I have a fetish for everything antique (and my husband knows this), so I was in total bliss.  The service was great, the breakfast was perfect.  The only thing amiss for me was a fluffy bathrobe.  I don't usually pack one knowing most hotels will have one for me.  This would have been greatly appreciated.  Thank you for the fabulous two days!  Oh, and parking for unloading is right in front of the hotel.  They will direct you to a safe parking lot just a block away.

Summary Heading: Old style charm with a view
Summary: I wasn't sure what to expect when I stayed here with my wife for an overnight getaway.  I grew up in the area and was never even aware it was here!  However we were extremely happy with our visit.  The room was extremely well decorated, the views were awsome, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom shower (always a biggie with me!) had plenty of pressure and hot water.  The manager (?) who checked us in was very friendly and helpful, even showing us some of the other rooms available as each room is individual and decorated with a different motif.    The 'breakfast' was definitly European style (basically toast, bagels and cereal) but it was just fine with us, as it was located in a tastefully decorated breakfast room and balcony overlooking the pier.  The night club across the way

My 8 yr old, my husband & I stayed here for 2 night (Sat & Sun). We went through Expedia and got a great deal. Knocked off $30 on the room rate. Upon inquring, I spoke with Andrea & she recommended room #4 bec it had a door to a semi-private balcony. She reported that room 8 is the noisiest. This golden information made our trip memorable ( in a good way). The sitting room has a fireplace, a table for two, a mirrored dresser and a day bed w/ add'al pull out matress. The king bed is open to the sitting room and this is the only room for tv access. The bay window serves as a seat but not comfy. The balcony access is shared by another room. Breakfast was easier access bec of this. Open view of parking lot, partial ocean and across from a busy bar. Ear plugs helps! Our fav part

Summary Heading: A Quaint change from the Plastic Hotels!
Summary: Stayed at the Doryman's Inn and we just loved it!! We stayed in room 9, it was small for the amount payed per night but, it had a door that opened to the balcony where we were able to sit at any time to relax and enjoy the sites of Newport Beach. It also allowed us to have friends over to sit, get reacquainted and not feel shut in the room!!! Staff very helpful and friendly and location was great and if you are lite sleeper ask for another room away from the street!!! Though I enjoyed the atmosphere!! Go and eat at the Il Faro restaurant quint and good service...and after go to the Blue Beet Bar a few doors down for live music, dancing and drinks!!! Down side the wifi is bad!!!! But the fireplace in the room made it worth while putting up with it!!!

Summary Heading: Very nice historic hotel on the beach in Newport
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and had a great time.  We took advantage of the 'deal' that was offered in conjunction with a very special dinner at 21 Oceanfront which is located directly below the hotel.  We had the corner room and had an amazing view of the pier as well as the beach.  The noise from the street was a little loud, but you have to expect that when staying on the beach in Newport.  It's kind of a party atmosphere.  There are a lot of nice restaurants as well as beach bars nearby, so it's a great place to come and relax and enjoy the sights and sounds of the beach.

Having a window to relax in makes a big difference in Newport Beach. You can relax and look out at the ocean. We've been staying here for years and love it. Friendly staff, nearby ammenities, reserved parking all make it a great experience. Eat at Sol or Crab Cooker. BreaKfast is lacking, but go down the sidewalk to Mutt Lynches.

An ideal location for enjoying the open window beach breeze and sounds. The rooms are immaculately furnished in early US antiques. In addition the beds are well kept and very comfortable. My stay was a bit out of season so most of the hotel was empty. The Continental breakfast we decent and severed near the balcony. There is complementary WiFi and decent for business work. The value is just ok based on price, but very nice place.

Summary Heading: nice place to get away with the wife
Summary: not for kids. but perfect to get away with the wife. the food downstairs and the view is amazing. we will go back here soon

Summary Heading: Poor sleep for an expensive room
Summary: My husband and I are originally from Newport Beach and are very famiiliar with the area.  We had always wanted to stay at the Doryman Inn and thought my husband's birthday would be the perfect occasion to return to Newport Beach to celebrate.  The hotel is in a beautiful building, and the rooms are nicely decorated.  The hotel is located in an area with many great bars and restaurants which suited us perfectly.  That's where the good ends.  The bed was beyond awful.  It was so uncomfortable.  It was lumpy and sagged in the middle.   Neither my husband nor I slept much at all.  By 5 a.m. we gave up trying.  Due to the lack of sleep I ended up with a horrible cold and I felt miserable.  But it doesn't end there.  The breakfast was cold cereal and bland store-bought muffins.  The

I loved the Inn.  The lady at the front desk was so sweet and accomodating.  She really cares about the guest comfort.  She was there when we checked in, there when we went to bed, and there when we checked out.  Our room was very nice (room 2).  It looked out onto the peir and the ocean.  I must admit I didn't know what a Roman tub was until we stayed at the Doryman, but I wasn't disappointed.  The gas fireplace and old books were a nice touch.  The bubble bath products smelt great.  If you are looking to be in a convient location, this is the place to stay.  We didn't have to walk more then a couple of feet out of the Inn's doors to find bars and restaurants.  The restaurant 21 Oceanfront, had an amazing view and great food (there is a dress code).  A couple staying at the Inn

Summary Heading: The Blush is Off the Rose
Summary: We have stayed here several times over the past 10 years.  This time was not nearly as good as previous stays.  Nobody told us that #2 had a loud rumble all afternoon and in to the night.  The machinery making the rumble (AC compressor?) also interfered with the television, putting 30 oscillating vertical lines of interference on the picture.  I called after the stay to try and resolve the matter, but both times the manager was out and the receptionist was unenthusiastic about taking a message.  As for breakfast, I would eat at the great coffee shop across the parking lot.  Eggs, oatmeal, pancakes; anything you want. The high point of the trip would be the place up the boardwalk with gelato.  Try chocolate with a shot of espresso over it.

The location, on Newport Beach, is well-positioned right at the pier on the beach. The rooms are charming with a vintage victorian decor (feels a little like a brothel....in a good way). Beds are amazingly comfortable. We spent two nights at the Doryman in room 9 and room 10. The rooms are  filled with flowers, beveled mirrors, sunken marble tubs, skylights, fireplaces. Room 9 has a door to the balcony where we enjoyed our coffee and breakfast. It does get loud at night. It's right on the beach and surrounded by bars...it didn't really bother us, but if you are looking for quiet and an early night, you should be prepared with earplugs.  Parking was a bonus.   Below the hotel, is the Ocean 21 Restaurant which is dubbed NB's finest/most romantic. I enjoyed the food and cocktails.

Summary Heading: The Doryman Inn is an enchanted hidden gem right in the middle of beautiful Newport Beach.
Summary: We spent two nights at the Doryman Bed and Breakfast, and I was pleasantly surprised the minute we arrived. The hidden elevator to the second floor is enchanting, and once the elevator door opens, you enter a timeless hotel. Filled with Victorian ambiance, you realize that this is no ordinary hotel. The rooms are exquisite, filled with flowers, beveled mirrors, sunken marble tubs, skylights, fireplaces and most rooms have windows with bay seating that overlooks the amazing ocean! Below the hotel, is the Ocean 21 Restaurant which is also a treasure.  I was able to refresh my soul, write, read, take walks along the beach, fall in love all over again, and make incredible memories. We will definitely return to this hidden gem!!  Connie Willson

Summary Heading: The best place to stay for privacy, rest and relaxation plus great food nearby!!!
Summary: Finding the hidden door and elevator that takes you upstairs to the front desk check-in is secretive and alluring.  Once upstairs we were greeted by a very pleasant lady that remembered us from our previous visit.  Our room wasn't quite ready as we had arrived an hour early so we stashed our bags and trekked off to the nearby market.  While in the market we received a phone call letting us know that our room was ready so after we finished our shopping we walked back to the hotel -- actually its a B&B.  We got checked in and unpacked; then it was time for us to find lunch.  There are a lot of excellent eateries nearby -- Rockin' Baja, the Crab Cooker and more.  The boardwalk was a carnival atmosphere and the water was a bit chillier this year than last year but we still had great

Summary Heading: Not worth the money and the hassle
Summary: I just got off the phone with the manager of the inn and restaurant.  Doryman's Inn and the restaurant 2100 Oceanfront are owned by same owner.  Before my phone call with the manager I would have rated my experience an overall 2, but now after having to resolve a disputed credit card charge I am downgrading it to a 1. My wife and I just got married at the courthouse in Norwalk, CA in February 2010. We wanted to get away from work and just enjoy a couple of days to ourselves. I wasn't sure where to go, but I wanted to stay in Orange County because we wanted to stay close to home in the San Gabriel Valley and we we wanted to treat some friends to dinner in the OC who helped us with our marriage. I had not booked any hotel yet bc I couldn't really tell whether the hotels were worth

We were looking for a romantic spot in Newport Beach so we tried the Dorymans Inn.  We booked room # 8 at a price point over $400 a night for our special occasion.  When we arrived, we found no one manning the front desk (that happens a lot here), our room was open, the door ajar, and our luggage inside, the room itself extremely hot and uncomfortably warm with the air conditioning turned off.  We asked the front desk about the heat and we were told to turn the thermostat on if we wanted air conditioning. After a quick search, we found the room's thermostat (which came with very kludgy directions stapled next to it on the wall and a warning not to overset the temp or it would burn up). We had to close all our windows (which was actually a plus, as we faced the pier, parking, and

Summary Heading: Great location, but don't expect breakfast
Summary: I stayed at the Doryman's Inn for one night on the recommendation of a waitress at the Tommy Bahama's in Newport Beach. (Gorgeous food, friendly staff. Go eat at the Tommy Bahama's.)  It's got great location, right on the Newport Beach peninsula and across from the pier. You couldn't ask for a better place. The hotel also wins for: * making a last second reservation for me over the phone (9 pm on the night of) * decent shower, both pressure and space (for an old building, I was surprised) * comfort and fun stuff in the inn (wish I'd had a chance to stay longer in order to use the furniture; also wish I'd gotten to stay in a larger room)  The hotel fails, however, on: * food. This is not a bed and breakfast. It's a "bed and maybe a rubbery, store-bought muffin or scone that you

Newport   Beach;  Doryman's Inn - Bogus B.& B. Date;   January 11th  2009 Reviewer;  Deanna from San Diego,  CA.  I love to travel and do so quite regularly.  My passion is to explore new "B.& B.'s" all over California.  Having heard the Fisherman's lore and history of the Doryman Inn, and already experiencing so many numerous other B.&B.'s, I decided for a visit timed right on my birthday.  I checked into a room oceanfront, which I had pre-screened.  Nice view, cozy room, however there were a couple minor issues;  a non-working phone, and broken lights.  The room was poorly lit as a result of the missing fixtures.  The phone was a problem as I had to use a land-line that evening for something, and had no access.  I had to postpone a B.D. phone visit w/ someone till the
We really liked the atmosphere here.... an authentic Newport Beach experience with the harbor, the ocean.  The restaurant was great, the service friendly.

Summary Heading: Absolutely loved this Bed and Breakfast
Summary: We found the Doryman online and loved the concept of a beachside bed and breakfast. It was one of the most pleasant stays we've had. Leaving our windows open, we went to sleep each night to the sound of ocean waves. The breakfast was always good and you could sit out on the balcony looking over the ocean and pier. Free parking is included in your room price along with breakfast. This makes the price very reasonable. We are looking forward to going back as soon as possible and staying in the same room.

My husband and I made the reservation en route from spending a few days camping in the Anza Borrego Desert. They had a lovely room available, with an ocean view. We booked for 2 nights and since we were staying on a Thursday the first night we were able to take advantage of the lesser weekday rate. The room was cozy but had everything we needed, including a huge sunken marble tub! What a surprise.  They couldn't have been more accommodating when we needed to keep our vehicle in their lot even after we checked out. No fuss, no muss.

We booked a room at Doryman's from their website. Our first night we stayed in room 4. It was a beautiful suite with a balcony access to newport pier and the hussle and bussle of the beach activity. I thought it was a blast to be right at the hub of activity and watch all the people. For the next 6 days we stayed in room 8. It was right on the oceanfront...it was fun and all the help were so good to us in everyway. We couldn't have been more pleased. I would highly recommend it and we would certainly go again!! Great morning breakfast too. Good fruit and great scones!! Loved it, loved it, loved it!!!

Doryman's Inn is FIRST CLASS all the way!  What a fun location... right at the beach.  21 Oceanfront restaurant is right downstairs... talk about DELICIOUS!  such a professional operation through & through.. no wonder it's been rated the BEST in OC for 4 decades!!

Doryman was a disgrace to the title of Bed & Breakfast.  The rooms were below average. The outside noise would not let you sleep until 3-4 in the morning. The phones were not functional. The service was awful. And the breakfast was the worst we have ever had. If you are in the mood for bran muffin, cold boiled eggs with out any toast or other bread, and coffee then Doryman is good for you!

Upon reading some questionable reviews about this hotel, I was hesitant to book it. However, the price was right and you can't beat the location(for the area).  I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness, comfort and quiet of this hotel. I especially like how they keep each room's door open until the guest checks in to that room. When we arrived, we took a peak into the rooms that had open doors to get a glance at what this hotel had to offer.  I had opted for the least expensive room,#5, and was totally satisfied. However, some rooms, #10, are huge! There was a king and a couch that folds out, not to mention a cute sitting table to enjoy the view.  The bed was so cozy with cushiony down comforter. You can't beat the location. You are on the beach, we layed in bed watching

Summary Heading: A Beach Flop Masquerading As A B & B
Summary: Nevermind the French bordello meets Wild, Wild West decor, this place plain sucks.  It is directly over three bars (one of which has rooftop seating right ouside the windows of the higher numbered rooms) so you cannot go to sleep before 3:00 a.m.  But you better get your winks in quickly because waves of trash trucks come through at 7:00 a.m.  So, as you teeter on the edge of your sagging bed praying that the mating rituals of the 20-something crowd below will end, all you can think of is Dorothy clicking her heels together and wishing she could go home.  On our way out the door expressing our dissatisfaction to the desk clerk we were told "yes, it (the bar noise) is really terrible on the weekends"; would have been nice if they'd been as candid when the reservation was booked.

Summary Heading: They canceled our wedding night reservation...
Summary: So my husband and I booked 2 nights at the Doryman's Inn - our wedding night + the night after.  Being a local couple, and having a plethera of out of town guests, we decided to host family at our house the 2nd day.  After we toured the hotel, we asked the "manager" to cancel our 2nd night reservation.     Fast forward to our wedding night - we left the reception and drove to the Inn.  When we arrived (still dressed in our formal wear) we checked in - I noticed the name on the reservation slip was different, and pointed it out to the receptionist.  She merely told me to fill in the "correct name."  We checked into the room - it was lovely at first glance.  There were rose petals scattered all about the room - it looked very nice.  We were hungry, so we went downstairs to the

Summary Heading: The Worst B&B Experience I've Ever Had!!
Summary: I really wanted to like this unique inn, however, 2 nights in room #9 and 1 in room #6 have convinced me otherwise.  It seems as if the owners are operating this place on auto-pilot without giving it the love and care such a historical building requires.  As soon as I checked into room #9, I noticed a number of key lights that were inoperable. When housekeeping came, they only had a 15 watt bulb or a flood light (for the bedside light), no replacement bulbs. It is hard to believe that a place with such unique lighting fixtures does not readily carry replacement bulbs.  They finally found a long bulb with a better wattage, which looked odd but got the job done.  It was never changed for the 3 days I was there (and,is no doubt still there).  The center light, the main light

Summary Heading: Worth it to be on the beach.
Summary: We stayed in room #8 for one night ($400 w taxes included).  I think this is their highest priced room.  It was nice - comfortable and clean with a nice view of the beach out one side of the room.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Great location right on the beach.  Room was big and fairly clean.  We could hear the band at 21 Oceanfront at night in our room, but they stop playing by 10 or 11 pm.  The breakfast was pathetic. Not much on offer and they kept running out of everything, including coffee. (My expectations were not high, but still disappointed.)  Il Farro Caffe and 21 Oceanfront are both excellent restaurants right near the hotel.  We opened our bags a couple hours after leaving and found a couple cockroaches in them.  Made me cringe, but I would probably still

Summary Heading: Cute but with it's share of problems
Summary: To give you an idea of what my standards are I've stayed in some beautiful B&Bs over the years and am generally happy in anything from a nice Residence Inn room to a five star hotel - depending on the circumstances and as long as they are clean and tidy.   Translation, my standards are probably a little on the high side.  I've dropped $500 a night in San Francisco because I wanted a bathroom that overlooked the bay and Alcatraz (I'm a woman if it makes any difference) and it was *worthy every hard earned buck*.  By the same token, a Residence Inn stay has been nice because it was clean, roomy, and for the most part QUIET.    Our original room at the Doryman (so you already know where this is going) was pretty nice with a GIGANTIC and beautiful canopied bed, but no real sitting

I am not sure what one should expect from an Inn that advertises itself as a Bed and Breakfast, but we were expecting to spend couple of romantic nights after our wedding in an upscale Inn (paying $365 + 10% Tax per night), and enjoy decent breakfast to say the least. What we got for breakfast were old bagels, a toaster that only had one working slot, left over fruit from the first day, uncovered milk jug, poor tea bag choices with no stocking in pantry. We have stayed in generic < $100 per night inns and have been served better breakfasts. Yes we had an ocean view room, in a romantic setting, but we had an Aladdin Kleenex box. Maybe we are being picky, but the hotel's management knew that we were newly weds. What is romantic about a Aladdin Kleenex box. How hard it is to stock

We went here for our 3rd anniversary. The hotel seemed old and a little dated. Yes it was romantic, but I prefer 5 star accomadations I suppose. What we definatley loved was the restaurant!!!!!! Also we partied around the town, easy walking to several bars Stag bar, Blue beat, Sharky's, Beach Ball, we hit them all!!

Summary Heading: Victorian Romance with and Oceanview at the Doryman!
Summary: The Doryman's Inn is a gorgeous Victorian bed and breakfast overlooking the ocean right in front of Newport Beach's Pier. We went for our anniversary and stayed in Room #1 and it was beautiful. This was a corner room with three windows overlooking the ocean. The rooms are all very different and beautifully decorated. I kept from giving it five stars as there aren't a lot of little extras that are typical with bed and breakfasts. Coffee and tea was supposedly available at all times, but coffee wasn't made so we had tea instead (after the attendant went to boil water). The breakfast is on a beautiful patio or inside on tableclothed tables, but it was basically a continental breakfast that was very standard - nothing really gourmet. The location is fantastic and the rooms are clean

Victorian hideaway, lovely antique furnishings, and wonderful breakfast dining facility and food. Restaurant on site extraordinary. Will definitely return to this lovely Bed and Breakfast on the beach.
